eu.cqse.check.base

Class HardCodedLiteralsCheckBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.core.CheckImplementationBase
      • eu.cqse.check.base.HardCodedLiteralsCheckBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbapHardCodedUsernameCheck, HardCodedPasswordCheck

    public abstract class HardCodedLiteralsCheckBase
extends CheckImplementationBase
    Base class for checks on hard-coded character literals. Subclasses check literals which match getLiteralRegex() (if specified) and which occur in context with an identifier (e.g. assignment, comparison). The identifier is checked with isMatchingIdentifier(IToken). findAllMatchingLiteral() can be overwritten if all literals matching getLiteralRegex() should produce a finding, regardless of the context where these occur. The checks works on pre-processed tokens, thus implementing checks must have the parameter ECheckParameter.ABSTRACT_SYNTAX_TREE enabled.

      • lookupIdentifierIfInOperation

        protected java.util.Optional<IToken> lookupIdentifierIfInOperation(IToken literal,
                                                                   boolean leftHandLookup)
        Performs a lookup for the identifier, if the given literal is stated within an operation where on the other side of the operator an identifier is stated
        Parameters:
        leftHandLookup - determines if identifier should be search on the left side, otherwise it is expected on the right side of the operator.
        Returns:
        An Optional holding the IToken of the identifier, empty optional if no identifier found.

      • lookupIdentifierIfInCaseWhen

        protected java.util.Optional<IToken> lookupIdentifierIfInCaseWhen(IToken literal)
        ABAP Specific function Performs a lookup for the identifier if the given literal occurs as an WHEN option inside a CASE/WHEN structure.
        Returns:
        An Optional holding the IToken of the identifier which controls the CASE/WHEN structure, empty optional if no identifier found.
